intro: Thelypodium rigidum, commonly known as rigid thelypodium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are usually rigid and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Thelypodium rigidum produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators.
